version_description: * Big update with lots of fixes and improvements, and access to all features after an in-app purchase.
* Big update with lots of fixes and improvements, and access to all features after an in-app purchase.

This is a major update to Pocket Universe Express!

* Refreshed user interface, optimized for all current devices.
* New features including a new "land the rocket" mini-game and NGC objects.
* Fancy new 3D rendered objects and improved sky view.
* Many bugs taken out behind the shed and er.. sent to the farm.

This is a major update to Pocket Universe Express!

* Refreshed user interface, optimized for all current devices.
* New features including a new "land the rocket" mini-game and NGC objects.
* Fancy new 3D rendered objects and improved sky view.
* Many bugs taken out behind the shed and er.. sent to the farm.

Plenty of updates in this version!

* New-look dashboard display, with a mini-What's Up view (tap it for the full-sized one)
* First version of a "Night sky tour" feature, to point out interesting things to look for. Let me know if you like it!
* Many, many bugs sent to the big bug farm.

Plenty of updates in this version!

* New-look dashboard display, with a mini-What's Up view (tap it for the full-sized one)
* First version of a "Night sky tour" feature, to point out interesting things to look for. Let me know if you like it!
* Many, many bugs sent to the big bug farm.

Meanwhile, far out in the uncharted backwaters of the unfashionable end of the western spiral arm of the galaxy, on a planet orbiting a small unregarded yellow sun, an ape descendant spent his evenings and weekends working on fixing some software that other ape descendants used on their phones. On this planet, ape descendants thought phones were a pretty neat idea, and they would spend all their time staring at the screens and sending each other pictures of themselves and arguing about a particular ape descendant with orange hair.

The planet had a problem, in that many of the people on it were unhappy. Many solutions were proposed, but most of them involved the people just being nice to each other, and for some reason, many of the people weren't very at doing that, and insisted on telling the rest of the people what they were doing wrong, and giving them rules to follow.

The ape descendent working on the software didn't like it when all the people were being mean to each other, and instead tried to write software to show them that they were all really rather small organic things, floating on a rock in a gigantic universe, and they all really needed to get some perspective and just chill out a lot more.

And so:

New! All features are unlocked on Thursdays for you to try them out! I never could get the hang of Thursdays..
New! Night tour - your nightly talking guide! Opens when the sky is dark.
New! Dashboard now has at-a-glance What's up view (tap it for more).
Fixed! Fixed issues with location.
Fixed! Resolved problems switching to and from landscape in many views.
Fixed! Corrected WikiPedia links issue.
Fixed! Compass points location corrected on iPad.
Fixed! Removed stereo mode for now, as it caused Bad Things to happen.
Tweaked! Updated launch screen and opening animation.
Tweaked! Controls on Virtual Sky view updated.
Terminated! Loads of bugs given a good hasta la vista, baby.

Pocket Universe continues to be updated, fixed, and improved.

*New*
Support for iMessage - send your friends the current Moon phase or monthly sky news

*Updated*
Astronomical events for 2017

*Bug fixes*
Daylight time graph
Location setting
Other things..

Sorry there's nothing amusing in this What's New but.. you know.

*Updated*

*Bug fixes*
Daylight time graph

Other things..

Sorry there's nothing amusing in this What's New but.. you know.

2017 Solar Eclipse Tracker added to in-app purchase
Fixed issue with mythological outlines.

2017 Solar Eclipse Tracker added to in-app purchase
Fixed issue with mythological outlines.

This is a big update, with many issues resolved and some cool new features!

Some of the highlights include:

* New AR features - enjoy a model Solar System on your desk!
* Search for the brightest satellites, by name or from a a list (it used to include Humanity Star, but that one just burned up. awww...)

Many other bugs have been fixed. Enjoy!
